moves.1. e4: Another taken from the Chelyabinsk Variation tournament
moves.6. Ndb5: This opens up some interesting possibilities, the b knight has an eye on d6 and c7 the c knight is looking at d5, note also the white queen has a half open file.
moves.6... d6: Almost forced, black now has the d6 square defended by his queen and his dsb
moves.7. Nd5: Applies some considerable pressure to c7
moves.7... Nxd5 8. exd5: The knight choices are limited now, if he moves to b4 for example I can chase it around a little while developing some of my pieces, so gaining some tempo
moves.8... Ne7: Probably the best option however blacks dsb now cannot develop without moving another piece first
moves.9. c3: Opens the line to a4 for my queen, note that there is a nice line to the king - a4-e8, I did consider c4 but felt that restricted my lsb too much
moves.9... a6 10. Qa4: threatens mate with Nxd6. Black is under some severe pressure now and will surely have to lose material to save the game
moves.10... axb5: Possibly the only option that allows black to survive
moves.11. Bxb5+ Bd7 12. Bxd7+ Qxd7: forced, I can now gain the rook
moves.13. Qxa8+: Up to this point we were still in the Gameknot database!
moves.13... Nc8: Unsurprisingly black declines to exchange queens
moves.14. O-O Be7 15. Qa5 b6: Trying to pressure my queen but I think this is a mistake as it allows my queen to get into a slightly better position. Should black have castled instead?
moves.16. Qa6 O-O 17. Be3 Bd8: My development is finally complete and I am ready to throw my pawns forward on the queens side
moves.18. b4 Qf5: This move is a bit of a mystery to me ...
moves.19. a4: So I continue with my plan ...
moves.19... e4:
However the purpose of it now becomes clearer.

I think this is a mistake as he now has 3 weak pawns and I can easily cover mine
moves.20. Qc4 Ne7: Still going for my d pawn
moves.21. Rfd1: I used this rook as the other was supporting the pawn push and my f pawn is protected by my dsb
moves.22. a5 bxa5 23. bxa5: I decided to take with my pawn as a8 is white and black has no lsb, it is also more tricky to get his knight into a useful position on that side, which meant that I thought this pawn had some good chances to cause problems
moves.24... Ne5: I wasn't sure what the big benefit of this move was at the time, though we will see later
moves.25. Qb5 Bc7: Allows his rook to protect the a8 square
moves.26. a7: Continuing the push. The pawn here is well defended
moves.26... Nf3+: This move scared me, if I take with the pawn I am in big trouble, 27 gxf3, exf3 means that my king is potentially trapped on the back row by his pawn.
moves.27. Kh1: f1 would have lost my h pawn, there is little he can do now though to threaten my king even though it is cornered
moves.28. gxf3:
Black threw in the towel.

Thanks for reading
